adjective.description: Having more than one thread, multithreaded (also figurative); (Engineering, of a screw) = "multithreaded".

noun.description: Computing. Each of the multiple parts of a program executed concurrently in multithreading.

verb.description: To employ multithreading in the performance of (a program or process).

origin: Early 20th century. From multi- + thread. Compare earlier multithreaded<br>1970s; earliest use found in Computer Bulletin. From multi- + thread.
